activities: Au Pair International serves as a liaison between host families and au pair participants in the United States Au Pair Program. Personal information received from candidates who originate from EU/EEA And/Or Switzerland includes, but is not limited to: Personal identification information, address, work history, education, criminal background information, etc. All data collected is used to qualify each candidate for the au pair program and to eventually match him/her with a host family in the United States.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Applicants wishing to be placed in the United States in the Au Pair Program are required to submit applications which contain personal information (containing information on health, childcare experience, and educational background) which is necessary to determine their eligibility for participation. The data covered includes manually processed data.
recoursemech: EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
